subject: Psychology
title: Cognitive Psychology Pioneers
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Cognitive Psychology Pioneers.

hook.text: George Miller published a paper with an unforgettable title: 'The Magical Number Seven, Plus or Minus Two.'

buildup.text: Miller showed that short-term memory holds about seven items â€” a finding that shaped interface and communication design.

discovery.text: Ulric Neisser coined the term 'cognitive psychology' in his 1967 book, giving the field its name and manifesto.

twist.text: Broadbent, Atkinson, and Shiffrin built models of attention and memory still taught in every intro psych course.

climax.text: These pioneers proved that invisible mental processes could be studied as rigorously as visible behavior.

punchline.text: They made the invisible mind a legitimate object of science.

quiz.question: What did George Miller's famous paper demonstrate?
options: Short-term memory holds about seven items
People can only remember two items at a time
